intro: Malcolmia halophila, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant is adapted to saline environments, making it a halophyte capable of thriving in coastal soils with high salt content. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Malcolmia halophila is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and aesthetic appeal.
